channel.title: The Honorable Tim Scott
channel.description: The Honorable Tim Scott U.S. Representative Carolina's First District (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: The past four years of "Hope and "Change" have led me to one simple conclusion:
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: Our only "Hope" is to "Change" the current resident of the White House.
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: And I am so proud to support the next President of the United States, Governor Mitt Romney!
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: You see, as a poor kid growing up in a single parent household in North Charleston, South Carolina, I felt like I didn't have much going for me.
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: But I did have a couple of things. A mom who believed in tough love. And that love comes at the end of a switch.
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: And my momma loved me a lot!
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: And a small business owner who was my mentor. And taught me that I could "think my way out of poverty." He taught me that having a job is a good thing but creating jobs was even better.
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: Mitt Romney embodies the same vision for America that my mentor had for me.
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: He believes that the path forward is more important than the place where we begin.
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: And let me close by giving President Obama a heartfelt message from the good people of South Carolina:
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott

item.title: Hit the road, Jack! And don't you come back no more, no more, no more!
item.author: The Honorable Tim Scott
